meaningMnemonic: You’ve already learned 仕方, which you know means "method" or "way of doing." When you don’t (that’s the がない part) have a way of doing or achieving something, you could say it can’t be helped, it’s no use, or there’s no other way. Makes sense, right? This is a popular phrase in Japanese, so we're sure you'll encounter it a lot!
readingMnemonic: You already know how to read this from having learned 仕方, so you should be good to go!
